full_text:
Re: Fwd: Epstein/Washington Post question
From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
To: Lee Plourde
Date: 2019/08/26 15:23
Subject: Re: Fwd: Epstein/Washington Post question
Attachments: TEXT.htm
(b)(3)
(b)(5) 8/26/2019 3:18 PM >>>
I'm drafting a response to this WA Post reporter now (he emailed us too).
(b)(5)
(b)(6) Public Information Office
Federal Bureau of Prisons
(202) 353-(b)(6)
>>> Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> 8/26/2019 3:12 PM >>>
Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone
------- Original message -------
From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) @washpost.com>
Date: 8/26/19 3:00 PM (GMT-05:00)
To: BOP-IPP/PublicAffairs@bop.gov, Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov>
Subject: Epstein/Washington Post question
>>> (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) 08/26/2019 15:00 >>>
Hi-
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) from the Washington Post here. We are in the process of working on a story about the cameras outside Jeffrey Epstein's cell on the morning of his death. 1
Can the BOP comment on that assertion? Is the functionality of cameras a larger issue at BOP or MCC? Are you able to say what other cameras might have captured that ni
Thank you,
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) | The Washington Post
(202) 629-(b)(6) (cell)

additional_notes: The document is an email chain discussing a query from The Washington Post regarding cameras outside Jeffrey Epstein's cell. The email contains redactions marked as (b)(3), (b)(5), (b)(6), and (b)(7)(C).
